import category_theory.category

/-!
# Lists of Composable Morphisms

In this file we define lists of composable morphisms, and their composition.

We also show that a list of composable morphism is the same as a functor from `[n]`
(the category `0 ‚ü∂ 1 ‚ü∂ ... ‚ü∂ n`) to the category.

## Main Definitions

- `list_fun X Y` where `X, Y : C` for some category `C` is a list of composable morphisms starting
from `X` and ending at `Y`.

- `list_fun.comp L` where `L : list_fun X Y` returns the composition as a morphism `X ‚ü∂ Y`.

-/

-- TODO: port every lemma about list ever

universes v u

namespace category_theory

variables {C : Type u} [category.{v} C]

/-- A list of composable functions -/
inductive list_fun (X : C) : C ‚Üí Type (max u v)
| nil : list_fun X
| cons : Œ† {Y Z}, (Y ‚ü∂ Z) ‚Üí list_fun Y ‚Üí list_fun Z

notation a :: b := list_fun.cons a b

namespace list_fun

/-- The composition of a list of composable functions.
Set up so that `comp (f :: g :: nil) = (ùüô ‚â´ g) ‚â´ f`. -/
def comp {X : C} : Œ† {Y}, list_fun X Y ‚Üí (X ‚ü∂ Y)
| _ nil := ùüô X
| _ (f :: L) := L.comp ‚â´ f

@[simp] lemma comp_nil (X : C) : (nil : list_fun X X).comp = ùüô X := rfl
@[simp] lemma comp_cons {X Y Z : C} (f : Y ‚ü∂ Z) (L : list_fun X Y) :
  (cons f L).comp = L.comp ‚â´ f := rfl

/-- Concatenation of two lists of composable functions. -/
def append {X Y : C} : Œ† {Z}, list_fun Y Z ‚Üí list_fun X Y ‚Üí list_fun X Z
| _ nil         L‚ÇÇ := L‚ÇÇ
| _ (cons f L‚ÇÅ) L‚ÇÇ := cons f (append L‚ÇÅ L‚ÇÇ)

@[simp] lemma nil_append {X Y : C} (L : list_fun X Y) : nil.append L = L := rfl
@[simp] lemma cons_append {X Y Z W : C} (f : Z ‚ü∂ W) (L‚ÇÅ : list_fun Y Z) (L‚ÇÇ : list_fun X Y) :
  (cons f L‚ÇÅ).append L‚ÇÇ = cons f (L‚ÇÅ.append L‚ÇÇ) := rfl

@[simp] lemma comp_append {X Y : C} : ‚àÄ {Z} (L‚ÇÅ : list_fun Y Z) (L‚ÇÇ : list_fun X Y),
  (L‚ÇÅ.append L‚ÇÇ).comp = L‚ÇÇ.comp ‚â´ L‚ÇÅ.comp
| _ nil         L‚ÇÇ := by rw [comp_nil, nil_append, category.comp_id]
| _ (cons f L‚ÇÅ) L‚ÇÇ := by rw [cons_append, comp_cons, comp_cons, comp_append, category.assoc]

end list_fun

end category_theory

/-

Authors: Kenny Lau

import category_theory.functor_category

/-!
# Lists of Composable Morphisms

In this file we define lists of composable morphisms, and their composition.

We also show that a list of composable morphism is the same as a functor from `[n]`
(the category `0 ‚ü∂ 1 ‚ü∂ ... ‚ü∂ n`) to the category.

## Main Definitions

- `list_hom X Y` where `X, Y : C` for some category `C` is a list of composable morphisms starting
from `X` and ending at `Y`.

- `list_hom.comp L` where `L : list_hom X Y` returns the composition as a morphism `X ‚ü∂ Y`.

-/

-- TODO: port every lemma about list ever

universes v‚ÇÅ v‚ÇÇ u‚ÇÅ u‚ÇÇ

namespace category_theory

variables {C : Type u‚ÇÅ} {D : Type u‚ÇÇ}

/-- A list of composable functions -/
inductive list_hom [has_hom.{v‚ÇÅ} C] (X : C) : C ‚Üí Type (max u‚ÇÅ v‚ÇÅ)
| nil  : list_hom X
| cons : Œ† {Y Z}, (Y ‚ü∂ Z) ‚Üí list_hom Y ‚Üí list_hom Z

namespace list_hom

notation a :: b := cons a b

section has_hom

variables [has_hom.{v‚ÇÅ} C] [has_hom.{v‚ÇÇ} D]

/-- Concatenation of two lists of composable functions. -/
def append {X Y : C} : Œ† {Z}, list_hom Y Z ‚Üí list_hom X Y ‚Üí list_hom X Z
| _ nil       L‚ÇÇ := L‚ÇÇ
| _ (f :: L‚ÇÅ) L‚ÇÇ := f :: (append L‚ÇÅ L‚ÇÇ)

notation a ++ b := append a b

@[simp] lemma nil_append {X Y : C} (L : list_hom X Y) : nil ++ L = L := rfl
@[simp] lemma cons_append {X Y Z W : C} (f : Z ‚ü∂ W) (L‚ÇÅ : list_hom Y Z) (L‚ÇÇ : list_hom X Y) :
  (f :: L‚ÇÅ) ++ L‚ÇÇ = f :: (L‚ÇÅ ++ L‚ÇÇ) := rfl

end has_hom

section category_struct

variables [category_struct.{v‚ÇÅ} C] [category_struct.{v‚ÇÇ} D]

/-- The composition of a list of composable functions.
Set up so that `comp (f :: g :: nil) = (ùüô ‚â´ g) ‚â´ f`. -/
def comp {X : C} : Œ† {Y}, list_hom X Y ‚Üí (X ‚ü∂ Y)
| _ nil      := ùüô X
| _ (f :: L) := L.comp ‚â´ f

@[simp] lemma comp_nil (X : C) : (nil : list_hom X X).comp = ùüô X := rfl
@[simp] lemma comp_cons {X Y Z : C} (f : Y ‚ü∂ Z) (L : list_hom X Y) :
  (f :: L).comp = L.comp ‚â´ f := rfl

end category_struct

section category

variables [category.{v‚ÇÅ} C] [category.{v‚ÇÇ} D]

@[simp] lemma comp_append {X Y : C} : ‚àÄ {Z} (L‚ÇÅ : list_hom Y Z) (L‚ÇÇ : list_hom X Y),
  (L‚ÇÅ.append L‚ÇÇ).comp = L‚ÇÇ.comp ‚â´ L‚ÇÅ.comp
| _ nil       L‚ÇÇ := by rw [comp_nil, nil_append, category.comp_id]
| _ (f :: L‚ÇÅ) L‚ÇÇ := by rw [cons_append, comp_cons, comp_cons, comp_append, category.assoc]

variables (F : C ‚•§ D)

def map {X : C} : Œ† {Y : C}, list_hom X Y ‚Üí list_hom (F.obj X) (F.obj Y)
| _ nil      := nil
| _ (f :: L) := F.map f :: L.map

@[simp] lemma map_nil {X : C} : (nil : list_hom X X).map F = nil := rfl
@[simp] lemma map_cons {X Y Z : C} (f : Y ‚ü∂ Z) (L : list_hom X Y) :
  (f :: L).map F = F.map f :: L.map F := rfl

@[simp] lemma map_append {X Y : C} : ‚àÄ {Z} (L‚ÇÅ : list_hom Y Z) (L‚ÇÇ : list_hom X Y),
  (L‚ÇÅ ++ L‚ÇÇ).map F = L‚ÇÅ.map F ++ L‚ÇÇ.map F
| _ nil       L‚ÇÇ := rfl
| _ (f :: L‚ÇÅ) L‚ÇÇ := congr_arg (cons (F.map f)) $ map_append L‚ÇÅ L‚ÇÇ

end category

end list_hom

end category_theory
